title: BA (Hons) / BSc (Hons) Psychology
description: Find out more about our BA (Hons) / BSc (Hons) Psychology and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: Undergraduate Law courses
description: Learn more about our BA (Hons) Law, LLB (Hons) Law and BA (Hons) Business Law and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: BA (Hons) Business Studies
description: Find out more about our BA (Hons) Business Studies and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: Sociology, Social Policy and Criminology courses
description: Find out more about our Sociology, Social Policy and Criminology courses, and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: BA (Hons) Film and Media
description: Join us to find out more about our BA (Hons) Film and Media and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: Undergraduate History
description: Join us to find out more about our BA (Hons) History, BA (Hons) Scottish History and BA (Hons) History and Heritage courses, and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: Marketing courses
description: Learn more about our BA (Hons) Marketing and BA (Hons) Retail Marketing and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: BA (Hons) Biology courses
description: Join us to find out more about our Biology courses including Animal Biology, Biology, Cell Biology, and Marine and Freshwater Biology. Get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: Undergraduate Computing Science
description: Join us to find out more about our BSc (Hons) Computing Science and BSc (Hons) Software Engineering courses, and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: BSc (Hons) Economics
description: Find out more about our BSc (Hons) Economics and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.

title: Undergraduate Nursing
description: Join Lecturer in BSc/BSc (Hons) Adult Nursing and BSc/BSc (Hons) Mental Health Nursing, Gillian Beattie, to find out more about our learning facilities and Clinical Skills labs, the course benefits and structure, student placements and more.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: BSc (Hons) Sport and Exercise Science
description: Find out more about our BSc (Hons) Sport and Exercise Science and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc Human Rights and Diplomacy
description: Join Course Director, Dr Damian Etone, to find out more about our MSc Human Rights and Diplomacy and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: MLitt Creative Writing: November
description: Join Course Director, Dr Lorna Gibb, to find out more about our MLitt Creative Writing and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: MLitt Creative Writing: February
description: Develop your writing talent in poetry, fiction, or creative non-fiction. This course is suitable for all whether you'd like to gain new creative skills or you're already established in your career. Join course director, Dr Lorna Gibb, to find out more about the course.

title: Postgraduate Publishing Studies courses: April
description: Join Course Director, Dr Caroline Wintersgill, and Lecturer, Dr Louisa Preston, to find out about our MLitt and MRes Publishing Studies courses led by the Stirling Centre for International Publishing and Communication - a world-leading centre for postgraduate study in publishing.

title: Gender Masters Courses: March
description: Join Course Director, Dr Eamon McCarthy, to find out more about our MSc Gender and Diplomatic Practice and MLitt/MSc Genders and Sexualities courses.

title: MPH Public Health
description: Join us to find out more about our MPH Public Health and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc/MA Human-Animal Interaction: February
description: The Masters looks at human–animal interactions across a wide range of contexts – from pet owning to animal-assisted interventions, zoos, farms and conservation. Course Director, Dr Clare Andrews gives more information about this course.

title: MSc Advanced Computing with AI: March
description: Prepare for a career in advanced software development or artificial intelligence (AI) with this course. You'll learn advanced programming with an emphasis on applications of AI. Join Dr Sandy Brownlee, course director, in this webinar to find out more about the course.

title: MSc Advancing Practice
description: Find out more about our MSc Advancing Practice and studying at Stirling.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: Postgraduate Aquaculture courses: March
description: Learn in a leading institute for sustainable aquatic food production. Our Aquaculture courses explore aquatic animal biology, environmental issues, nutrition, reproduction and genetics, disease and health management. Join course director, Dr Armin Sturm, to find out more about our postgraduate Aquaculture courses.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Big Data postgraduate courses
description: Find out more about our Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Computing and AI, and Big Data postgraduate courses at Stirling.
subjects: Computer science and software engineering, Data science and data analytics

title: MSc Artificial Intelligence: February
description: Artificial Intelligence has become a popular conversation topic as it's becoming an everyday technology, it's in our cars, in our homes and even in health care. Find out more about this exciting new field of computing in our webinar with lecturer Dr Saemundur Haraldsson.

title: MSc Autism Research: February
description: Our Masters in Autism Research is a unique course to give you an in-depth understanding of both psychological research methods and current topics in autism research. Join Course Director, Judith Lowes, to find out more.

title: MSc Big Data: February
description: Big Data skills are high in demand, helping companies make sense of large amounts of data and make better decisions. In this webinar, Dr Sandy Brownlee, course director, will give an overview of the course and answer questions.

title: MSc Criminology: March
description: Our Masters highlights international perspectives on criminology and criminal justice. We're ranked 1st in Scotland and top 15 in the UK for Criminology (Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2025). Join the course director, Dr Niall Hamilton-Smith, to find out more about our MSc Criminology.

title: MSc Data Science for Business
description: Join us to find out more about our MSc Data Science for Business.

title: MSc Dementia Studies
description: Join us to find out more about our MSc Dementia Studies and get answers to any questions you have about studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Digital Banking and Finance
description: Find out more about our MSc Digital Banking and Finance and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.
subjects: Accounting and finance, Data science and data analytics

title: MSc Digital Banking and Finance: April
description: This Masters course gives you the knowledge and analytical skills you’ll need for a successful career in banking and finance in an increasingly digital world. Meet Course Director, Dr Michael Watts, to find out more about the course.

title: Marketing Masters degrees
description: Stirling is ranked 2nd in Scotland for Marketing (The Complete University Guide 2025). Join Course Directors Professor Rob Angell and Dr Carolyn Wilson-Nash, to find out more about our MSc Marketing Analytics, MSc Marketing and MSc Digital Marketing and Brand Management courses.

title: MSc Digital Media and Communication: February
description: Develop the core professional skills required for a career in digital media management and production. This course allows you to develop analytical, creative, and production skills with an understanding of human behaviour and communication. Join course director Professor Steven Buchanan to find out more.

title: MSc Education: April
description: Our Masters in Education is designed for established educationalists, aiming to advance their understanding of education, as well as those looking to convert their career to this field. Meet Course Director, Dr Kay Sidebottom to get lots more information about the course.

title: MSc English Language and Linguistics: March
description: Study the intricate workings of the English language, explore its central role in society and gain expert knowledge of contemporary linguistic theories. Join Course Director, Dr Bethan Benwell, to find out more.

title: MSc Environmental Management: October
description: Find out more about our MSc Environmental Management and studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Environmental Management: February
description: Our Masters degree will give you a solid grounding in the scientific principles that underpin Environmental Management. Our course allows you to specialise in an Energy, Conservation or Informatics pathway. Join this webinar to learn more from course director Professor David Copplestone.

title: MSc Environmental Remote Sensing and Geospatial Sciences
description: The course has a unique emphasis on developing and applying remote sensing solutions for understanding and monitoring structures and environmental processes on Earth and other planetary bodies. Join Course Director, Dr Evangelos Spyrakos, to find out more.

title: MSc Financial Technology (FinTech): October 2024
description: Find out more about our MSc Financial Technology (FinTech) and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.
subjects: Accounting and finance, Data science and data analytics

title: MSc Financial Technology (FinTech): February
description: Our MSc Financial Technology combines theory with practicality and provides the latest information in computing for the financial sector. This course is one of the first offered in the UK, join Dr Ashley McClenaghan, course director, to find out more.

title: MSc Health Psychology: February
description: Through teaching and practical experience, the MSc Health Psychology will give you the skills to help people deal with the psychological and emotional aspects of health and illness. Join Professor Julia Allan, course director, in this webinar to learn more about the course.

title: MSc Heritage: March
description: Our MSc Heritage provides you with a state-of-the-art, critically informed, interdisciplinary education in heritage. Join this webinar to hear more from Course Director, Dr Jennie Morgan.

title: MSc International Conflict and Cooperation: March
description: Our MSc International Conflict and Cooperation gives you the chance to address a variety of challenges facing states and international organisations today. Find out more from Course Director, Dr Clemens Hoffman.

title: MSc International Journalism: March
description: The course introduces students from a wide range of academic and professional backgrounds to the theory and practice of journalism in a global context. Hear more about the course from Course Director, Dr James Morrison.

title: MSc Mathematics and Data Science
description: Find out more about our MSc Mathematics and Data Science and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.
subjects: Data science and data analytics, Mathematics

title: MSc Mathematics and Data Science: March
description: This course combines maths with technology from data science, data analytics and artificial intelligence. Join lecturer, Dr Anna Kirpichnikova, to find out more about our MSc Mathematics and Data Science.
subjects: Data science and data analytics, Mathematics

title: MSc Media Management: February
description: Top 5 in Scotland for Media Studies, this course will help you develop theory and critical understanding of the digital, creative and media industries, and practical and analytical skills. Dr Errol Salamon, Course Director, will share more about what to expect from this course.

title: MSc Physiotherapy (pre-registration)
description: Join Course Directors, Dr Dylan Powell and Dr Ross Chesham, to find out more about our new MSc Physiotherapy (pre-registration) course and get answers to any questions you have about studying at Stirling.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc Podiatry (pre-registration)
description: Join Course Director, Dr John Veto, to find out more about our new MSc Podiatry (pre-registration) course and get answers to any questions you have about studying at Stirling.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc Psychological Research Methods: April
description: Our Psychological Research Methods course combines training in psychological theory with practical research skills development. Join the webinar to hear more from the Course Director, Professor Craig Roberts.

title: MSc Psychology: February
description: Have a degree in another subject but want to do Psychology? This intensive Masters course is accredited by the British Psychological Society (BPS) and includes a placement to give you practical experience. Join Dr Dimitrios Kourtis, course director, in our webinar to find out more about the course.

title: MSc Psychology of Sport: March
description: Study Sport Psychology at Scotland’s University for Sporting Excellence to gain the knowledge and skills for a successful career in the sports industry and beyond. Meet Course Director, Dr Robert Morris, to find out more about our MSc Psychology of Sport degree.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: Public Relations and Strategic Communication Masters courses
description: Join Senior Lecturer, Dr Will Dinan, to find out more about our suite of Public Relations and Strategic Communication postgraduate courses. We're ranked Top 5 in Scotland for Communication and Media Studies (The Complete University Guide 2025).

title: MSc Public Relations and Strategic Communication (Online)
description: Hear from Course Director, Dr Will Dinan, to find out more about our MSc Public Relations and Strategic Communication (Online) and find out more about studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Sport Management
description: Find out more about our MSc Sport Management and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc Sport Management: April
description: Kick-start your sports career with a Masters in Sport Management from Scotland's University for Sporting Excellence. Our Masters includes a placement within sport organisations. Join Course Director, Dr Claudio Rocha, to hear more information about the course.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc Sport Performance Coaching: April
description: Join Course Director, Stephen Macdonald to find out more about our online Masters in Sport Performance Coaching at Scotland's University for Sporting Excellence.
faculties: Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport

title: MSc Substance Use (Online): March
description: Our MSc Substance Use is ideal for current practitioners looking to develop/further their career in the field of substance use, as well as for individuals looking to build on their undergraduate studies. Join lecturer, Dr Danielle Mitchell to learn more about the course.

title: MSc Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) courses
description: Our courses draw on in-depth practice from across the TESOL sector so you'll graduate with the knowledge and practical classroom skills to be a confident teacher. Find out more from Course Director, Dr Adnan Yilmaz.

title: Postgraduate accommodation information session
description: Join our Accommodation Team for an insightful session on everything you need to know about student housing. Discover the variety of accommodation options available, learn how to navigate the application process, and get answers to all your questions about living on campus.

title: Postgraduate Student Immigration Team information session
description: Join our Student Immigration Team to learn more about the student visa process. Discover the steps you might need to take in order to prepare for your studies and to ask any questions you might have.

title: Postgraduate tuition fees and funding for UK students
description: Join our UK Recruitment Team for this session to learn more about paying your tuition fees, how to apply for funding, and scholarships you may be eligible for as a postgraduate student from the UK. This webinar also includes advice that may be relevant to students from the Republic of Ireland.

title: International introduction to Stirling
description: Meet our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.
series: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

title: International introduction to Stirling
description: Meet our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.
series: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

title: Introduction to Stirling for students living in an EU country
description: Join our Europe Team to learn more about the University of Stirling and get some advice on submitting your application.
series: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

title: Introduction to Stirling for students living in a non-EU European country
description: This session is for anyone living in a non-EU European country. Learn more about the University of Stirling and get some advice on submitting your application.
series: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

title: Scholarships and funding for international students
description: Our International Recruitment Team tell you about the scholarship opportunities available to you as an international student, and give guidance on how to apply for funding.
series: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

title: International Introduction to Stirling: November
description: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.

title: Introduction to Stirling
description: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.

title: Introduction to Stirling: January 2025
description: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.

title: International Introduction to Stirling: March
description: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.

title: International Introduction to Stirling: April
description: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out more about studying at the University of Stirling. They'll also provide advice about applying to Stirling.

title: Undergraduate introduction to Stirling and student panel
description: Our recruitment team give you an intro to all things Stirling. You'll also hear from our current students about what it's like to study here.

title: How to apply and write your personal statement
description: Learn more about the application process for our undergraduate courses, and get advice from our recruitment team about how to write your personal statement or answer the structured questions provided by UCAS.

title: Undergraduate international students
description: Hear from our International Recruitment Team about applying to the University of Stirling as an international student.

title: Undergraduate tuition fees and funding for UK students
description: Our UK Recruitment Team tell you more about tuition fee payments, how to apply for government funding and scholarships you may be eligible for as an undergraduate student from the UK (Scotland, England, Northern Ireland, Wales).

title: Sport at Stirling
description: Hear from David Bond (Head of Performance Sport) to learn more about getting involved in sport during your time at the University of Stirling: as a performance athlete, part of a student-led team or a member of the gym.

title: Student support and accommodation
description: Our Student Support and Accommodation teams give you more information about the support available to you during your studies (academic, mental health, money) and the options we offer if you want to stay in University-managed housing.
